title: St. Thomas Municipal Airport (North Dakota)
text:
St. Thomas Municipal Airport is a public use <a href="airport">airport</a> located one <a href="nautical%20mile">nautical mile</a> (2 <a href="kilometre">km</a>) northeast of the <a href="central%20business%20district">central business district</a> of <a href="St.%20Thomas%2C%20North%20Dakota">St. Thomas</a>, a city in <a href="Pembina%20County%2C%20North%20Dakota">Pembina County, North Dakota</a>, United States. It is owned by the St. Thomas Airport Authority.
Facilities and aircraft.
St. Thomas Municipal Airport covers an area of 50 <a href="acre">acre</a>s (20 <a href="hectare">ha</a>) at an <a href="elevation">elevation</a> of 837 feet (255 m) above <a href="mean%20sea%20level">mean sea level</a>. It has one <a href="runway">runway</a> designated 17/35 with an <a href="asphalt">asphalt</a> surface measuring 2,600 by 50 feet (792 x 15 m).
For the 12-month period ending October 8, 2008, the airport had 1,716 aircraft operations, an average of 143 per month: 99% <a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a> and 1% <a href="air%20taxi">air taxi</a>. At that time there were 10 single-<a href="aircraft%20engine">engine</a> aircraft based at this airport.
